headline: How clashes at the L.A. protests escalated to tear gas, impact rounds
description: Videos and photos show how L.A.’s protests unfolded Sunday when the National Guard arrived.

headline: Four races to watch as Democrats fight to retake the Senate
description: Senate Minority Leader Charles E. Schumer says his party can retake the Senate in next year’s midterm elections — but Democrats face daunting odds.

headline: Do kids feel safe in D.C.? We asked them.
description: Youth crime in the District surged in 2023. The Post spoke to nearly two dozen middle school students about violence and safety.

headline: Maps and Timeline of the L.A. Immigration Protests and the Federal Response
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: President Trump called in the National Guard on Saturday after isolated clashes between federal law enforcement and people protesting immigration raids.

headline: A powerful, opaque al-Qaeda affiliate is rampaging across West Africa
description: With up to 6,000 fighters, JNIM is now the most well-armed militant force in the Sahel — and among the most powerful in the world, officials and experts say.

headline: First, Snubs. Then Flattery. Now Trump and Musk Are at War.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: A timeline of the praises and insults that President Trump and Elon Musk have lobbed at each other shows how their volatile clash was years in the making.

headline: Trump travel ban rattles immigrant communities across U.S.
description: Haitian, Afghan and Iranian immigrants say the policy has dashed their dreams of reuniting with family. Many worry about their place in America.

headline: Read the Insults Hurled Between Trump and Musk
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: A bitter online feud kicked off between the once-close allies on Thursday. Here are some of their pointed exchanges that played out throughout the day.

headline: The Age Issue: More of Congress Is 70-Plus Than Ever Before
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: At the highest level, the U.S. government looks like a gerontocracy, with average ages around 60 in both the House and the Senate.

headline: See the 19 countries Trump’s travel ban affects
description: Mapping all the countries from which President Donald Trump’s executive order would restrict travel to the United States.

headline: See the Countries Under Trump’s New Travel Ban
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Restrictions on travel will affect people from more than a dozen countries worldwide.

headline: The Loneliness Epidemic, in Data
description: No description available

description: No description available

headline: An Illustrated Guide to Who Really Benefits From ‘No Tax on Tips’
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The effect of the tax break is actually quite narrow.

headline: The Gutting of America’s Medical Research: Here Is Every Canceled or Delayed N.I.H. Grant
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Some cuts have been starkly visible, but the country’s medical grant-making machinery has also radically transformed outside the public eye.

headline: These regions have poor air quality from Canadian wildfire smoke
description: See where the flow of Canadian wildfire smoke has worsened the air quality in the U.S.

headline: Deportation flights accelerate, reaching a high under Trump.

description: No description available

headline: Deportation Flights Reach Highest Level Under Trump So Far
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Times analyzed the messaging in broadcast spots, on which campaigns and outside groups have spent millions, to identify the major themes in the race.

headline: Ukraine Hid Attack Drones in Russia. These Videos Show What Happened Next.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Videos and satellite imagery show how the attack unfolded and its aftermath.

headline: Washed ashore
label: https://www.scmp.com/hong_kong/
description: Discover what is taking a toll on dolphins, porpoises and whales in this special visual explainer.

headline: 10-Minute Challenge: A Surrealist Scene by Gertrude Abercrombie
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: The MAHA Report’s AI fingerprints, annotated
description: The Post reviewed the more than 500 citations in the MAHA Report. Here are the patterns of AI use we found.

headline: White House MAHA Report may have garbled science by using AI, experts say
description: The report, led by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., was intended to address the reasons for the decline in Americans’ life expectancy.

headline: Cancer Drugs Cost More Than Ever. They Often Don't Extend Lives
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: Pharmaceutical companies are making billions on treatments that can sometimes overpromise and underdeliver for terminal cases.

headline: Mexico’s Judicial Reform Is Now In the Hands of Confused Voters
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/
description: No description available

headline: Trade Crime Is Soaring, U.S. Firms Say, as Trump’s Tariffs Incentivize Fraud
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: President Trump’s steep global tariffs have supercharged efforts to evade them. Some U.S. companies say the government is ill equipped to keep up.

headline: Can you spell like a champ? The national bee’s pronouncer tests your skills.
description: Jacques Bailly, a past Scripps National Spelling Bee winner, has served as the head announcer for decades. He picked 10 words for The Washington Post’s quiz.

headline: What we lose when weather balloons don’t fly
description: Meteorologists are launching fewer weather balloons across the United States as the National Weather Service loses staff. Some worry forecasts will suffer.

headline: Sonic Detectives Want to Help SpaceX Listen Up
label: https://www.nytimes.com/science/
description: Physicists who record rocket launches and landings are learning important facts about the acoustics of spaceflight.

headline: Pets on Hong Kong public transport: a visual guide on how the city is relaxing rules
label: https://www.scmp.com/hong_kong/
description: Explore how Hong Kong is relaxing public transport rules for pet owners.

headline: The U.S. has more than 1 million foreign students. Here’s who they are.
description: International students are at the center of Trump’s latest escalation against Harvard. Experts say they make key contributions to the nation’s economy and research.

headline: How Donald Trump Has Remade America’s Political Landscape
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The steady march to the right across a vast number of counties reveals the extent of the nation's transformation in the Trump era, and the seriousness of the Democrats' problems.

headline: What Republicans’ new tax bill would mean for state and local tax deductions
description: The fate of the state and local tax deduction, or SALT, is dividing lawmakers by geography as well as politics.

headline: A Complete List of Everything in the Republican Bill, and How Much It Would Cost or Save
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: In hundreds of provisions across taxes, spending and more, the G.O.P. megabill would preserve lower tax rates for most Americans, increase federal debt by nearly $3 trillion and make large cuts to Medicaid and other federal programs.

headline: Ukraine Rebuilds Its Energy Grid With Lessons From the Frontline
label: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/
description: No description available

headline: In Firing Watchdogs, Trump Sidesteps Laws and Moves to Expand Power
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The abrupt, premature dismissals of agency officials has teed up a Supreme Court decision that, if delivered in the president's favor, could give him substantially more authority.

headline: The findings — and scientific problems — in White House ‘MAHA Report’
description: Parts of the “MAHA Report” contradict scientific consensus.

headline: How Every House Member Voted on the G.O.P. Megabill
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The House voted 215 to 214 to pass the domestic policy bill that will deliver President Trump’s domestic agenda.

headline: How every House member voted on Trump’s big budget bill
description: The One Big Beautiful Bill contains many parts of President Donald Trump’s tax and immigration agenda. See how your lawmaker voted.

headline: Was Your Home Damaged by the L.A. Fires? We Want to Hear About Your Home Insurance Claim.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Share your story with us.

headline: How Trump Has Targeted New Groups for Deportation
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Trump administration has made drastic changes to immigration policy to drive up deportation numbers. Here is an overview of recent actions and the people they affect.

headline: U.S. Debt Is on Pace to Set a Record High, Going All the Way Back to 1790
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: If Republicans pass their tax and spending megabill, the record will arrive even sooner — putting America’s debt at more than 113 percent of the size of its entire economy.

headline: You asked: Are vaccines approved without safety studies?
description: No, this is not true. Vaccines undergo rigorous safety testing and are continuously monitored for adverse events.

headline: The fate of Trump’s agenda rests with the House GOP’s ‘five families’
description: They call themselves the ‘five families.’ This week will test whether the House GOP’s factions can come together to advance Trump’s big bill.

headline: Audio Data Shows Newark Outage Problems Persisted Longer Than Officials Said
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Times analysis of air traffic recordings and flight data shows that outage-related problems persisted far longer than what the officials have acknowledged.

headline: Where local forecast offices no longer monitor weather around-the-clock
description: For at least half a century, the National Weather Service has been an around-the-clock operation. That is no longer possible in parts of the country.

headline: The top 25 WNBA players for the 2025 season
description: Another WNBA season begins Friday. Our list ranks the league’s best players.

headline: The Global Happiness Curve Is Collapsing. What Does That Mean?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/video/
description: For decades, research showed that the way people experienced happiness across their lifetimes looked like a U-shaped curve: Happiness tended to be high when they were young, then dipped in midlife, only to rise again as they grew old. But recent surveys suggest that curve is starting to flatten. Christina Caron, a Well reporter, explains.

headline: The Major Supreme Court Decisions in 2025
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: In a term that was increasingly overshadowed by emergency requests related to President Trump’s swift executive actions, justices heard arguments on transgender rights, the role of religion in public life, gun violence and speech online.

headline: Let’s chat about RFK Jr. and vaccines. Send us your questions.
description: Post health reporters will answer your questions on Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s plans for public health during a live chat at 10 a.m. ET on Friday.

headline: Indian strikes on Pakistan damaged six airfields, Post analysis finds
description: A review of satellite images and aftermath videos found that the strikes damaged three hangars, two runways and a pair of mobile buildings used by the air force.

headline: You’re probably eating more sugar than you think. Try our quiz to find out.
description: Take our quiz to test your knowledge. The answers might surprise you.

headline: 185% Tariffs: How the Trade War Hit One Shipment of T-Shirts
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Even with a temporary reprieve, tariffs have begun to squeeze importers. See how.

headline: Chosen one: a visual guide to Pope Leo XIV, leader of the world's 1.4 billion Catholics
label: https://www.scmp.com/world/
description: Explore our infographic on Leo XIV, the first American pope, and how he was elected as leader of the Catholic Church.
